intro: Rauvolfia obtusiflora var. trichophylla, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its roots are notable for containing alkaloids, which have been used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
